name: add_to_temporary_list
description: Saves a temporary target for use during the trigger execution
syntax:
This is used to build lists in triggers.
If used within an any-trigger, placement within the trigger is quite important. The game will iterate through every instance of the any-trigger until it finds a single instance that fulfills the requirements, and then it will stop.
In order to add every instance of a scope that fulfills certain conditions, use "count = all" while also placing this "effect" at the very end of the any-trigger (so that every condition is evaluated for every iteration).

name: time_of_year
description: Check if the current date is within the bounds
syntax:
time_of_year = {
min = 11.1 # default: beginning of year
max = 2.29 # default: end of year
}
Dates are formatted as "<month>.<day>" or just "<month>".
The check includes the min and max dates.
min can be larger than max, in this case we wrap around to the next year (i.e., February is between October and March).

name: trigger_else
description: Evaluates the triggers if the display_triggers of preceding 'trigger_if' or 'trigger_else_if' is not mettrigger_if = { limit = { <display_triggers> } <triggers> }

name: trigger_else_if
description: Evaluates the enclosed triggers if the display_triggers of the preceding `trigger_if` or `trigger_else_if` is not met and its own display_trigger of the limit is mettrigger_if = { limit = { <display_triggers> } <triggers> }

name: aptitude
description: What is the scoped character's aptitude in the target court position type? aptitude = { court_position = court_position_type value >= 1 }

name: attraction
description: Attraction value for the scoped character

name: average_amenity_level
description: average_amenity_level >= 3
syntax: Compares the scoped character's average amenity level to the given value, you probably never want to check for direct equality since the average will be some decimal number

name: base_weight
description: Base weight of the scoped character

description: will trying to hook the target character override the current hook? (if no current hook, always returns true)

description: can_arrive_in_time_to_activity_minimum = target_activity
syntax: Can the scoped character arrive to the target activity in time? (only does rough but performance consideration)

name: can_attack_in_hierarchy

name: can_be_acclaimed

description: Would the target character have been able to have children at the time of the scoped character's birth? Only age is taken into account

name: can_be_employed_as
description: can the scoped character be employed as target court position type?

name: can_be_parent_of
description: Would the scoped character have been able to have children at the time of the target character's birth? Only age is taken into account

name: can_benefit_from_artifact
description: Can the scoped character benefit from the main bonuses of this artifact?

name: can_create_faction
description: can the character create the faction of the specified type against the specified character?

name: can_declare_war
description: Can the scoped character declare war on the defender with the specified casus bellis on the defender character for the target titles with an optional claimant. can_declare_war = { defender = X casus_belli = Y target_titles = { Z } claimant = A }

name: can_diverge
description: Can this ruler diverge their culture? Includes checking the cost

name: can_diverge_excluding_cost
description: Can this ruler diverge their culture? Does not check the cost

name: can_embrace_tradition
description: Can scoped charater embrace new culture tradition?

name: can_employ_court_position_type
description: can the scoped character employ the target court position type?

name: can_equip_artifact
description: Can the scoped character equip given artifact?

name: can_execute_decision
description: Is the scoped character able to execute the asigned decision?

name: can_have_children
description: can the character have children? Only checks hard blocks from traits, not fertility

name: can_host_activity
description: can_host_activity = target_activity
syntax: Can the scoped character host the target activity type

name: can_hybridize
description: Can this ruler hybridize with the target culture? Includes checking the cost

name: can_hybridize_excluding_cost
description: Can this ruler hybridize with the target culture? Does not check the cost

description: can_join_activity = target_activity
syntax: Can the scoped character join the target activity

description: Can the scope character create if join a faction against the target?

syntax: Can the scoped character sponsor the target inspiration

description: Is the scoped character a realm neighbor of the target? Meaning they're independent or has the same liege, and border your realm. Including across two sea zones

name: character_men_at_arms_expense_gold_relative
description: What is the ratio of the scoped character's men-at-arms gold expenses, relative to their income?
syntax:
Similar calc compared to `ai_men_at_arms_expense_gold_min` / `ai_men_at_arms_expense_gold_ideal`.
(Relative value 0.0 - 1.0 - *, where 1.0 is all income, unraised maa costs)

name: character_men_at_arms_expense_prestige_relative
description: What is the ratio of the scoped character's men-at-arms prestige expenses, relative to their income?
syntax:
Similar calc compared to `ai_men_at_arms_expense_prestige_min` / `ai_men_at_arms_expense_prestige_ideal`.
(Relative value 0.0 - 1.0 - *, where 1.0 is all income, unraised maa costs)

name: completely_controls

name: completely_controls_region

name: council_task_monthly_progress

name: court_grandeur_current
description: Gets the current court grandeur value for a character, always NRoyalCourt::COURT_GRANDEUR_MIN for those without one

name: court_grandeur_current_level
description: Gets the current court grandeur level for a character, always 0 for those without one

name: court_grandeur_minimum_expected
description: Gets the minimum expected court grandeur value for a character, always NRoyalCourt::COURT_GRANDEUR_MIN for those without one

name: court_grandeur_minimum_expected_level

name: current_weight

name: current_weight_for_portrait

name: days_in_prison
description: number of days the character has been imprisoned for (0 if not imprisoned)

name: days_of_continuous_peace

name: days_of_continuous_war
description: Number of days the character has been in peace (0 if in peace)

name: days_since_death
description: number of days since the character has died.

name: days_since_joined_court

syntax: Gets the days since scoped character joined their current court

name: death_reason
description: Does the scoped character have the given death reason?

name: debt_level
description: Is the scoped character's debt level this value? -1 if not meeting any debt level threshold.
syntax:
0 for the first one, and so on.
Note that this might not match exactly with the modifier in effect as it calculates what the modifier will be now, and the character's actual modifier can lag behind

name: has_trait
description: Does the character have this trait or a trait of this trait group?

name: has_trait_rank
description: Compare the trait rank of a character to a value or other character.

name: has_trait_with_flag
description: does the scope character have a trait with a certain flag?

name: has_trait_xp
description: Checks if the scopd character has the given amount of XP in the trait level track. Track name is required if the trait has multiple tracks, otherwise should not be provided.

name: has_truce
description: Does the scope character have a truce with the target character? Truces are one way, which means we ask if the scope character can't attack the target character

name: has_usable_hook
description: does the character have a hook on the target that isn't on cooldown, has_usable_hook = <character>

name: has_weak_claim_on
description: does the character have an Unpressed Claim on the target title?

name: has_weak_hook
description: does the character have a weak hook on the target. A strong hook will *not* count, has_weak_hook = <character>

name: health
description: does the character have the required health?

name: highest_held_title_tier
description: what is the highest held landed title tier of the character?

name: highest_skill
description: Is the skill the highest skill (excluding Prowess) of the character? True even when there are multiple skills with the same highest value.

name: holds_landed_title
description: Is the scope character landed (holds a county or barony)?

name: hostage_duration
description: For how long has the scope character been a hostage? { days/months/years =,>,< X }

name: important_action_is_valid_but_invisible
description: is there an important action available to the character, but they dismissed it?

name: important_action_is_visible
description: is there an important action shown to the character?

name: in_diplomatic_range
description: Is the scope character and the target character within each others diplomatic range?

name: intrigue
description: does the character have the required intrigue skill level?

name: intrigue_diff
description: does the character have the required intrigue skill level difference against target?
syntax: intrigue = { target = character value <= script_value abs = yes/no(optional, default no) }

name: intrigue_for_portrait
description: Intrigue skill scaled between 0.0 and 1.0 for portraits

name: intrigue_lifestyle_perk_points
description: How many perk points available does the character have?

name: intrigue_lifestyle_perks
description: How many perks from this lifestyle does the character have?

name: intrigue_lifestyle_unlockable_perks
description: How many perks from this lifestyle can the character currently unlock? This checks that they have the parent perks, and that the can_be_picked is met. It doesn't check perk points

name: intrigue_lifestyle_xp
description: How many perk points available does the character have?

name: is_a_faction_leader
description: Is the scope character a leader of a faction?

name: is_a_faction_member
description: Is the scope character a member of a faction?

name: is_acclaimed
description: Is the given character the Acclaimed Knight of an Accolade?

name: is_accolade_successor
description: Is the given character the Successor of an Accolade?

name: is_activity_type_on_cooldown
description: Is the given activity type on cooldown for the current character.

name: is_adult
description: Is the scope character adult?

name: is_agent_exposed_in_scheme

name: is_ai
description: is the character played by AI?

name: is_alive
description: is the character alive or dead?

name: is_allied_in_war
description: Is the scope character allied to the target character in a war?

name: is_allied_to
description: Is the scope character allied to the target character?

name: is_at_home
description: is the character at home?

name: is_at_location
description: Is the character currently in the target province?

name: is_at_same_location
description: Is the character currently in the same province as the target character?

name: is_at_war
description: is the character at war? Does not consider your lieges' wars

name: is_at_war_as_attacker
description: is the character at war as an attacker? Does not consider your lieges' wars

name: is_at_war_as_defender
description: is the character at war as a defender? Does not consider your lieges' wars

name: is_at_war_with
description: Is the character at war with the target? Does not consider your lieges' wars

name: is_at_war_with_liege
description: is the character at war with their liege?

name: is_attacker_in_war
description: is the scope character in the target war as an attacker?

name: is_attracted_to_gender_of
description: does the sexuality of the scope character make them attracted to the target character?

name: is_attracted_to_men
description: Is the character attracted to men?

name: is_attracted_to_women
description: Is the character attracted to women?

name: is_away_from_court
description: Is the character away from the court?

name: is_betrothed
description: Is the scope character betrothed?

name: is_causing_raid_hostility_towards

name: is_character_interaction_potentially_accepted
description: Is the character interaction specified available and potentially accepted for the target character?
syntax:
is_character_interaction_potentially_accepted = {
recipient = character
interaction = interaction_name
secondary_actor = character <optional>
secondary_recipient = character <optional>
target_title = title <optional>
}

name: is_character_interaction_shown
description: Is the character interaction specified shown for the target character?

name: is_character_interaction_valid
description: Is the character interaction specified valid (shown and usable) for the target character?

name: is_character_window_main_character
description: Is the local player the main character in the character window?
syntax: An interface trigger, can only be used in specific places

name: is_child_of

description: is the character a claimant to any landed titles?

description: is the character a commanding an army?

name: is_concubine
description: Is the scope character a concubine?

name: is_concubine_of
description: Is the target character a concubine of the scope character?

name: is_consort_of
description: Is the character a spouse or concubine of the target character?

name: is_council_task_valid
description: Check if the task of the scope councillor is valid { task_type = council_position_type_key target = for_targeted_tasks }

name: is_councillor
description: Is the scoped character a councillor?

name: is_councillor_of
description: Is the scoped character a councillor for the specified character?

name: is_court_position_employer
description: is the scoped character employed in the target position by target character

name: is_courtier
description: Is the scope character a courtier?

name: is_courtier_of
description: Is the scope character a courtier of the target character?

name: is_cousin_of
description: Is the character a cousin of the target character?

name: is_decision_on_cooldown
description: Is the given decision on cooldown for the current character.

name: is_defender_in_war
description: is the scope character in the target war as a defender?

name: is_designated_diarch
description: Is the scoped character was diesignated as diarch by their liege?

description: Is the scoped character currently an active diarch of anyone?

name: is_diarch_of_target
description: Is the scoped character currently an active diarch of the target?

name: is_extended_family_of

name: is_female
description: Is the scope character female?

name: is_forbidden_from_scheme
description: Is the scope character forbidden from the target scheme?

name: is_forced_into_faction

description: Checks if the scope character is forced into the target scheme

description: Is the character a guest from another a court? In contrast to is_pool_guest the character has a liege

name: is_from_ruler_designer

description: Is the character a grandchild of the target character?

description: Is the character a grandparent of the target character?

name: is_great_grandchild_of
description: Is the character a great grandchild of the target character?

name: is_great_grandparent_of
description: Is the character a great grandparent of the target character?

name: is_heir_of

name: is_hostage_warden

name: is_immortal

name: is_in_army
description: is the character in an army (a commander or a knight)?

name: is_in_civil_war
description: is the character at war with their liege, or one or more of their vassals?

name: is_in_guest_subset
description: Is the scoped character in the specified guest subset in the activity they are
syntax:
involved in?
is_in_guest_subset = {
name = <subset_key>
phase = <phase_key> #Optional
}
If phase is not specified, it will check the current phase, otherwise it will
check all phases matching the phase key.

name: is_in_ongoing_great_holy_war
description: is the character in an ongoing (i.e. the war has started) great holy war?

name: is_in_pool_at

description: is the character imprisoned in a prison of the specified type? Accepts any static modifier (see also imprison effect).

description: Is the character in the same court as the target character (they have the same court owner or one is a courtier of the other)?

name: is_in_the_same_court_as_or_guest
description: Is the character in the same court as the target character (they have the same court owner or one is a courtier of the other)? Includes guests in the court.

description: is the character incapable?

name: is_independent_ruler

name: is_knight_of
description: Is the scoped character a knight of the target character

name: is_landed
description: Is the scope character landed (holds a county or barony)?

name: is_leading_faction_type

name: is_liege_or_above_of

description: Is the character a parent of the target character?

name: is_participant_in_activity

syntax: Is the scoped character a participant in the target activity

name: is_participant_in_war
description: is the scope character participating in the target war as an attacker or defender?

name: is_pool_character

name: is_scheming_against
description: Checks whether the scope character is an owner or an owner agent in a scheme agains target. There are 3 possible ways to use it:
syntax:
is_scheming_against = { target = X type = Y } limits to schemes of type Y
is_scheming_against = { target = X scheme_skill = Y } limits to schemes of Y skill category
is_scheming_against = { target = X } considers all schemes

NOTE: this is only for debug purposes and will not work in release mode!

Possible types:
conquest

conquest_claim
conquest_populist
election
inheritance
abdication
created
destroyed
usurped

revoked
independency
leased_out
lease_revoked
returned
faction_demand
swear_fealty
